page.title: 01Kimmeridge and Tyneham
page.content: This block includes some of the beautiful Purbeck coastline and about one third of the block is occupied by the English Channel. Of the land, the western portion (squares 1 (including the deserted village of Tyneham), 2,5,6 the Western Half of squares 3 and 7) is within the Army Gunnery Ranges and is uninhabited. Kimmeridge Village occupies much of square 8, it's 30 houses and one shop/post office/restaurant being occupied by retired people; local farm workers and fisherman; and others who commute to work in roughly equal portions. The whole block outside the army range is owned by the Smedmore Estate and most houses are rented or leased. In square 7, on top of the anticline, near the cliff, is an oil well which has produced oil for B.P. for 23 years. The oil is tankered.
